Reviews.Title: “Customer service very poor”
Reviews.Author: Amra A
Reviews.Content: Customer service was poor; my husband I and our 3 years old son stayed in this hotel last year in 2011 for 2 nights, this hotel is bad the rooms are very small our bed was attached to the wall my son had to sleep in a baby cot which was broken with some flat sheets and some smelly blankets. Landline phone was cutting off every time we use it But they still charged us. Downstairs reception guy was really rood and couldnâ€™t speak English. Next day they told us we need to leave the room they need to fix the air-conditioning and we wonâ€™t have any water for couple of hours all hotel . So we had to be outside with our 3 year old son walking around busy Istanbul which is beautiful city (country) Location was really good and the look out from the hotels balcony. Break first was ok. I donâ€™t recommend this hotel for the family maybe for singleâ€™s and boys traveling together.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: westbankEngland
Reviews.Content: We arrived in Istanbul on 28 March 2012 , was told by taxi driver it is better to change our hotel if we can !! As soon as got to our room , gone to receptionist to ask them to change our room but he said there were no noise. Our room was facing the main road which Trams running from 5 am till 12 pm. Noisy traffic and people outside till 2 am !!!! Despite asking for a quite room they refused to change our room. The walls in this hotel is thin which you can hear every activity of the next rooms in the middle of the night !!!!! Receptionist very unhelpful if you asking for any advice on directions or local information . Most of them could hardly speak English. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Booking problem”
Reviews.Author: jormaa
Reviews.Content: I had short trip to Istanbul modern. I made 2 weeks before booking via internet and paid my flight and hotel for two night. I arrive about at six at evening and hotel reseption told me they have over booking and i must use other hotel close to orginal.I was tierd and un happy so they offer free dinner to cover mistake.Other hotel was ok and clean but not same level what i paid.Seres save abouit 100lira(50E) for my flexibility. First night I had dinner in Seres restaurant and I order 1 bier for it. After finishing fine dinner waiter ask to pay that Bier. It was really sad sitution and I had terible bad vibes and i told that I do not pay bier.not nice arguments. I hope that Seres hotel can confirm pre bookings or be more diplomatic if they do mistakes, it is human of course make mistakes but you must be in map how you hande situtions.B Jorma

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: chris48
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a budget airline holiday. The price was really good so I wasn't sure what we would get. The first room we saw was very small, overlooked the backs of other buildings and smelled of smoke so we asked for another room. The next room was bigger and overlooked the street (first floor). We had ear plugs so the tram was not a noise problem but we really enjoyed watching people go by especially going in/out of the restaurant across the road and sitting in the tram as it went by! Excellent location, breakfast perfectly adequate with great views, lots of good restaurants within 10 minute walk and friendly staff. Also room really warm and water hot - as cold outside this was important. Good hotel for a short break - we were there 4 nights Dec 7-10.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a great position from major sightseeings”
Reviews.Author: WorkingAnts
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is rather simple and nothing exceptional but very near to GÃ¼lhane tram station, the central station and all major sightseeings. Nevertheless it's clean and the staff was very friendly giving us some hints on the public transportation. The dining room has a great view from Istanbul and the Bosporus strait. Breakfast is continental though you can choose from some Turkish specialties. Room was comfortable and clean but a little bit noisy since the tram line is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for stay”
Reviews.Author: Anasoma
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel for myself and my daughter for 2 nites based on expedia and travel advisor reviews.. was a little apprehensive, but when we got there we were pleasantly surprised by the hotel reception and the lobby where there were many foreigners. The hotel is clean and orderly. Staff are attentive. Bathroom is just ok, didnt like the shower curtain as it was too short and water came into the bathroom when you took a shower. We had a room that faced the tram line on 2nd floor, and didnt hear any noise while sleeping. Access to all sights were great; a short walk to eminonu for the ferry; we even walked over galata bridge. Also walked to the aya sofia 3 times and took tram a couple of times, this was all nearby. Public transportation access was excellent. Breakfast was included for us and was average. Overall, a decent and safe hotel to be at.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and Awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: jeff1184
Reviews.Content: Staff was wonderful and the hotel is right in the middle of everything.

Reviews.Title: “good location, friendly reception personnel but stingy behaviours”
Reviews.Author: gabpop
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 double rooms between 14 - 20 of April; the reception personnel was very friendly and helpful. Three main issues, for a hotel considered as a 4 stars, but in my opinion less than 3: 1. Unfortunately was a rainy days period, with temperatures under 9 Celsius, so after a half day trip in rain in Istanbul, a warm room was more than welcome. Unfortunately the policy of the hotel was to give heat into rooms only after 7 pm until 5-6 am, so to have an afternoon nap was a nightmare. Of course in te lobby the heat was working, so the hotel personnel to be warmed as the guests arriving... 2. Another problem: we are smokers, so in the morning we wanted to take the cafe into our smokers room, after breakfast; we were not allowed by the restaurant personnel; the condition to have the cafe in the room was to order to them, even in breakfast time and of course, to pay it accordingly as room-service!!! is the first time is happening, and believe me, these last 10 years I traveled a lot! 3. the last issue is related to the breakfast menu; it consisted only in cheese, olives, some cheap salami, boiled eggs, jam, honey, butter and of course corn-flakes with milk; it works 2-3 days, but then you get sick! at least some diversity and a hot corner, because space is enough, to make some eggs in different ways, pancakes, hot sausages, ham, etc, as almost 3 star restaurants have included in the breakfast. And by the way, don't make noise in your room, the neighbors hear everything!

Reviews.Title: “A safe bet - value for money”
Reviews.Author: mrmox2
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying there for a weekend with my younger daughter. I agree with most of the positive reviews on this page, but was a bit worried about the negative (many of them several years old, so they might have improved). Some complain about the noise. Well Istanbul is one of the largest cityes in the whole world so make up your mind what you expect. I dont spend my travel-days on a hotel room watching television, its just my base-camp. We stayed in 1st level, and I wouldnt complain about the noise. Its just the sounds of a large city. Small rooms? Well hotelrooms tend to be small. Even the top level best western hotel in Sevastopol in Ukraine has small hotel rooms. I wouldnt complaim. Some comlain about the breakfast. I am glad they serve the same breakfast every day. A huge buffet - it took my 3 days to taste about everything the had for us. And WHAT a view from the restaurant all over the city, the golden horn and bosporus - wonderful. And by the way - location is excellent for transportation and attractions. Would I stay here another time? If I need a safe bet I would definitely go there. Well, im not a man of safe bets, so probably I would try another hotel next time I visit Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: suzan87
Reviews.Content: I stayed there 4 night and it was fantastic (situation, cleaning, ...). The staff is friendly, helpful...

Reviews.Title: “Very Tiny rooms - watch out !”
Reviews.Author: nachaba70
Reviews.Content: Not a 4 star hotel for sure , very highly priced for little tiny rooms! Gave us single room for double occupancy ! Breakfast was ok, but could be improved - we stayed there 3 nights , everyday same breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4* hotel, in my opinion”
Reviews.Author: Balena_esuata
Reviews.Content: Liked: good position, near the historical center, nice decoration of the room, restaurant with very nice overview, prompt check-in - check-out, friendly (but forgetful) personnel. Not liked: tiny rooms, not enough space even for the luggage, curtain to the shower instead of shower cabin, noisy elevator (lucky us, our rooms was not near the elevator), nosy street (lucky us, our room was not over the street), nosy air conditioner engine (unlucky us, our room was overlooking the interior court, were the air conditioner engine was installed), shabby breakfast. Overall, it is a good choice if you are visiting for the fist time Istanbul and would like to see the old town, going by foot. But expensive, taking into consideration conditions offered.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very helpful staff, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: sweety96
Reviews.Content: Our room was a bit small and we had only three beds between four of us. The room was small to fit any extra bed, that was the only problem we had. Apart from that we had excellent breakfast, staff were very helpful, the tram station was very close. All the major attraction were within the walking distance. The hotel was clean throughout.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but a 2* not a 4*”
Reviews.Author: Shart7
Reviews.Content: Well the Seres is in a vey good location near the River, Blue Mosc, the Bizarres etc we walked nearly every where from this as a base, The Hotel staff were Pleasent. The Rooms were clean but shaby, We had booked a double and were shown to a twin room we asked to be moved they said the only doubles were room 10 on each floor they are small we said thats ok, But Room 10's on each floor back on the a ventalation shaft have no nateral light and are behind the lift motor. Anyway after Two nights we gave in as very little sleep not due to a good time being had by all but due to the fact everytime someone gets in the lift you get the devine Werrrr of the lift, and its a bit airless due to the only window opening to a ventilation shaft. We asked to be moved and they did so to a room at the front of the hotel large airy room with two singles a bit noisy from trams etc but fine really. The rooms have no Tea and coffee making trays in the rooms and some of the fittings are tired eg Lampshades damaged basins etc. Nothing showstopping but not what you might hope from a 4 star. Breakfast is well, basic, cold meats eggs, fruit, some form of Juice, and Tea and Coffee. The range is pretty good and the room overlooks the City but the quality we thought was poor. In Summary avoid the rooms baking on to the lift and ventilation shaft, (I think these were room 10 on each floor) expect a 2 star experience in a basic clean hotel and its a good base to see a fantastic city.

Reviews.Title: “suited my wife and I admirably”
Reviews.Author: daiporth
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel very good & would return again.Its position was ideal for our purpose,as we like wandering about at our own pace. our room was on the small side,but clean,comfortable & had all what we wanted,no view,but we didn't expect one. the view fro the restaurant made up for it.The buffet breakfast was more than adequate and the one meal we had in the evening was the nicest we had during our stay. As this hotel is in the old part of town the surroundings will be OLD,what do you expect

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: jurate
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 3 nights in February. firstly, the location is good: easy accesible from airport by two trains, Spice and Grand Bazars are close, Sophia and Blue mosque also, food shop (if you like to bring wine or raki bottle at the hotel room relaxing), souvenir and sweet staf shops around, etc. our room was small with windows facing yard with a bad view, but we got silence at night instead and we liked it. bed sheets have been changed daily, I believe. we had visited Cemberlitas hamam which is in a good llocation in 2 train stops, but really to pay 25 Eur was not worth, I know what is a real Turkish bath. but the environment there was not bad, about 400 y.o. by the way, the breakfast was uneatable for us, juice is made from the powder probably.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! Great price!”
Reviews.Author: frenchfrie73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Seres hotel early July 08, our first time in Istambul. We chose the Seres hotel for its location (Sirkeci), which worked out much better for us than Sultanamet. Hotel Seres is at the foot of Topkapi, Aya Sofia and the Blue Mosque. It is also extremely close to the Grand Bazaar and the Spice market. Almost directly in front of the hotel is the bridge to cross over to Taksim Square. The hotel is unpretentious but delivers what it advertizes: great location at a great price. Room were clean, spacious and the breakfast room has superb views of Topkapi and the Bosphorus. When booking your room ask for a superior floor (7th floor). Staff was very friendly and helpful. I understand that a hotel might be wonderful for some and so-so for others but if you are looking for a good price/location/value I can only recommend the Seres hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location, a little overpriced for what it offers”
Reviews.Author: karl_traveler
Reviews.Content: stayed for 3 nights in may, booked by phone. when we arrived we were happy to see that they prepared us a 'deluxe' room although we were paying a standard one. it had a nice view over the Topkapi palace (and over the back of surrounding buildings that weren't in the best shape). the room was large but there was really nothing 'deluxe' inside. found even holes in the bedsheet. i didnt see how the standard rooms where,but i imagine the street-side ones could be noisy. the roof restaurant has a really nice view but the breakfast was bad for the price we were paying. the location is good, in the historic center, can walk to all sites and there is also the tram that can take you on the other side- easy access to taksim square. not knowing the city i was wondering that beeing close to a train station (sirkeci) would mean not so nice area but all its ok. overall found it ok but a little overpriced for what you get and really nothig special, also it would be good to improve breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: AjaM80
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for 4 nights in August. The location of the hotel was excellent and the staff friendly but the room... there was nothing "elegant or luxurious" in our room. It was clean but much too small for two. Not more than 2 stars! Otherwise the hotel was ok and the restaurant on the top floor very nice - but nothing special in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: Long_Gone_Kiwi
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights in Hotel Seres. Of the standard rooms make sure that you get one with 2 twin beds as these are the larger rooms with a view over the street as is a better view for people watching while the dbl rooms I saw look out over the internal block. Location is great as itn't in the heart of the tourist area (which in July is just heaving with tourists) but a 10min walk, the location is also walkable for heading over to the area on the North side of the Galata Bridge. We found the rooms to be quite basic for the price of this 3*, the breakfast wasn't anything worth waiting round for either.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: BillBar513
Reviews.Content: I spent my last 3 nights in Istanbul at the Seres Hotel. It's an OK hotel but definitely nothing special. The staff was friendly and helpful when I needed directions. However, my room was just average. The decor was dated and the air conditioner didn't work. It was never fixed! I finally just shut it off and opened the window. Thankfully the nights were cool since it was early May. The hotel does have wireless internet access but only in the lobby which was usually filled with other guests smoking nonstop. Better than nothing I guess. Breakfast was served in their rooftop restaurant. But the best thing I can say about it is the view was great. The location is good. Close to 2 tram stations and the fairy terminals. It's very close to the Spice Market and is a short walk to Topkapi Palace and Archeology Museum.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun staff”
Reviews.Author: emilystrikesagain
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Seres for 14 days in June while I attended school at Istanbul University. The staff could not have been nicer in helping myself and my fellow American students adapt to Turkish life. It was our home for 14 days and truly felt like one. We read in the lobby, drank at the bar with the bartender, and took walks with some of the desk clerks. The rooms were small, but sufficient and it was in an excellent location. My room did not face the street, which I can imagine would be loud (on a busy street) but a courtyard, so it was quiet. I felt very safe. They also spoke sufficient English, which was helpful for our butchered Turkish.

Reviews.Title: “Not for non smokers.”
Reviews.Author: p.ben
Reviews.Content: PB from Stafford England. My wife & I stopped in this hotel for almost 2 weeks & we were not too impressed. The carpets in all rooms & corridors smelt of smelly feet! The air conditioners sent smoke into our room from other rooms. It was impossible to have breakfast without smokers smoking. We had to keep moving tables. All the breakfast buffet food got infested with the smoke. The location was good though & staff werenâ€™t too bad, as staff go. Would we recommend this hotel???â€¦..no not on your nelly!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A usual 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelB99
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and myself went to the Seres hotel for a weekend in September 2006. As is the general rule in Istanbul, the lobby and communal areas are more impressive than the rooms themselves. The room was rather small, which isnt so much a problem, but there are much bigger rooms in the hotel on the opposite side to which ours was. The room was generally clean and tidy although the bathroom needed updating quite badly. The main problem was the air conditioning or lack of it! After constant complaining we did get it fixed but it took nearly two days for the problem to be sorted. The terrace resturant for breakfast was more than adequate - with lovely views - but dont expect more than a turkish breakfast! The staff were very helpful. In general I would say this hotel is not without its faults, but its location within the city is good being in sultanahmet and close to the golden horn potentially makes it better than it is. It is a standard three star hotel, clean, tidy and functional but more in tune with business travellers needs than a couple I would think!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Catherine31Belgium
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Seres Hotel in Istanbul in January 2006. It was a wonderful experience and a really comforting place to return to at night, escaping Istanbuls hectic atmosphere. We had a twin bedroom, very clean, not very spacy but is that necessary when you should only sleep there? The bath room had everthing we needed and was kept clean every day. Staff was always friendly and ready to help. Breakfast included fruit, cornflakes, bread, pastries, yoghurt, cheeses en salamis, olives, juices...Everything you need to get you going and always fresh. There was airco that kept our room nice and warm. The receptionist of the hotel made overtime by driving us to the airport for more than a good price. I would recommend this hotel without a doubt. Congratulations to the Seres staff!

Reviews.Title: “average hotel central location”
Reviews.Author: jopyEdmonton_Canada
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Seres for 4 nights in Oct 2005 during Ramandan. The only thing it has going for it is that it is very centrally located within a 5 minute walk to Tropika Palace and Blue Mosque with a tram station running right in front of it. We had a standard room and it was not a bad size, but not very clean and the beds were very small. The blowdryer cord is filty and the cleanliness of the bathroom was not exactly 4 star standards either (it rates itself as a 4 star luxury special hotel). Their so call hot buffet breakfast consists of cheese, coffee, bread and cucmbers and tomatoes every morning. Good luck getting a non-smoking room. The ventilations in the rooms are all linked up. Each corner of the hotel has a cluster of 4 rooms and the ventilations intermingle. There are no non-smoking sections so if you end up with a major smoker next door, you are out of luck as you breath in the second hand smoke all night! Overall, it is more like a low 3 star hotel/motel but the staff is very helpful and polite. Double check the price you are getting at the hotel - sometimes you can get deals at less than 50% of the discounted rate on internet hotel providers. We paid $47 US internet rate with a hotel provider, then we decided to come into Istanbul early and was charge $75 ($100 US)Euros for the same room at even a hotel discounted price. At that price, there are several hotels next door and down the street that are better.

HotelInfo.Name: Seres Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Hudavendigar Caddesi 49 | Sirkeci, Istanbul 34420, Turkey
